column5: Decided to head to Toronto Island with a good friend of mine, to see if we could get into some of the pike action we've all been hearing about.  We just missed the fairy by five minutes, so we ended up catching the 11 O'clock fairy to the island.  And it wasn't until after we went to get a slice of pizza, that we got into some action.  Since we had never been there before we were trying to cover lots of water.  As soon as we got to the water after lunch, first cast for both of us and two fish landed and released.  Mine being my second biggest pike(guessing around 34") and my buddy with a little hammer handle.  As soon as we moved down a little further we got another two small pike and that was it for the day.  My buddy and I were both very impressed with the fishing and the scenery there and hope to be able to go back soon.  Here is some of my pics.  My second biggest pike       A little guy     And some of the scenery     Thanks for checking out my report!  Lovetofish
Great report!  Funny how the fishing sometimes just turns on like that.  Maybe pizza was the key...hmm...I'll have to remember that....LOL.  Congrats on some beauty fish!
thanks for the report!  maybe you should consider putting a few frozen pizza in ur tackle box
Nice fish! I would like try TO Island fishing if I get some time off.  Thanks for the report!
Nice Pike, wonder how busy its gonna be there this weekend?  Guess there's only one way to find out
some nice pictures, thanks for sharing.
what was your choice of lures ?
I think it was called a pizza. and scented the lure with tomatoe sauce   Nice fish by the way!!
Thanks for the comments guys.  lovetofish
thanks for the PM lovetofish...  so you used a live frog, eh? nice.
nice job!  You were fishing my favorite shoreline!
